issue.subject: Buttons stacked vertically
issue.description:
There are differents easySDI pages in FE where main toolbar buttons are stacked vertically, instead of horizontally.
_See attachment as illustration (diffusion page)_


We saw it first on our template (ASIT VD) and it is also visible when protostar (Joomla! default template) template is activated.

_Remarks : it is not visible in SI17 geoportal because it seems this defect was corrected (overided) by the template CSS._


Here are the pages where we saw this behaviour (all in menu "Manage" in My Resources):

- diffusion page (both tabs)
- relation page 
- application page

journals.notes:
Thanks Yves for these explanation.

Then, I agree with overidding the look with our template 

Alternatives : either add some easySDI CSS in the frontend or do not use the JToolbar class anymore... both are not good solutions.

BUT we need to add some documentation about "template prerequisites" to explain how a specific template should override this default behaviour (cause keep in mind that a user with protostar will have this vertical layout).

@Yves
Can you add a new entry in the WIKI ? 


@Bruno, Thomas
Do you agree ?

Started a page here : https://forge.easysdi.org/projects/easysdi/wiki/4_joomla_template_prerequisites
I someone sees other prerequisites to creation of template for EasySDI, feel free to add the here ;-)

Bruno
